intro: Cyphostemma pseudoupembaense, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, bead-like fruits. It is often found in rocky or dry habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its unique appearance and growth habits make it a notable species in its native ecosystems.
